Deal Description: Whirlpool Corp sold 24% stake in Indian unit via block deal, reducing holding from 75% to 51%. Goldman Sachs advised on the deal.
Counterparty: SBI MF / Aditya Birla Sunlife MF / Societe Generale (Buyers)

Deal Description: Reliance Retail and Havells entered race to acquire 31% controlling stake in Whirlpool India. Later Havells stepped back. EQT and Bain Capital emerged as top contenders, then also withdrew.
Counterparty: Reliance Retail / Havells / EQT / Bain Capital (Bidders)

Deal Description: Advent International entered exclusive talks to buy 57% controlling stake (31% direct + 26% open offer) in Whirlpool India for ~$1 billion. Deal collapsed in Dec 2025 over pricing disagreements.
Whirlpool Mauritius sold 11.23% stake (1.42 Cr shares) in Whirlpool India at INR 1,045/share via bulk deal.
Counterparty: HDFC MF / Kotak MF / Franklin Templeton MF / ICICI Prudential Life / Societe Generale / East Bridge Capital (Buyers)

Deal Description: Whirlpool parent planning to sell another 7.5% stake at ~14% discount via block deal to further reduce India holding towards 20% target.
Voltas completed transfer of its 92% direct investment in Saudi Ensas Company for Engineering Services to Universal MEP Projects, Singapore.
Voltas among 38 applicants in 3rd round of PLI scheme for white goods (ACs & LED lights) with proposed investment commitments.
Voltas Beko - 50:50 JV with Arcelik (Turkey) via Ardutch B.V. for consumer durables (refrigerators, washing machines, kitchen appliances). Sanand facility with 1M unit capacity.
Blue Star among 38 applicants in 3rd round of PLI scheme for white goods with committed investment proposals for AC manufacturing value chain.

Crompton acquired 55% stake in Butterfly Gandhimathi Appliances at INR 1,403/share. Also acquired Butterfly trademarks for INR 30.38 Cr. Launched mandatory open offer for additional 26% at INR 1,434/share.

Proposed merger of Crompton and Butterfly (swap ratio: 22 Crompton shares for 5 Butterfly shares). Public shareholders voted 72.61% against. Non-institutional investors voted 97% against. Merger rejected.
Bajaj Electricals demerged its power T&D (transmission & distribution) business into Bajel Projects Limited. Effective date: Sep 14, 2023. Bajel valued at INR 12,600M (INR 1,260 Cr).

Bajaj Electricals pursuing revival of manufacturing business of Hind Lamps Ltd (sick company since 2002 under BIFR). Structured as scheme of arrangement requiring NCLT approval. BEL holds 60% stake in Hind Lamps.
V-Guard completed acquisition of 100% stake in Sunflame Enterprises Private Limited (kitchen appliances) for all-cash consideration. Sunflame became a wholly-owned subsidiary.
V-Guard acquired remaining 26% stake in subsidiary Guts Electro-Mech Limited, making it a wholly-owned subsidiary.
V-Guard made additional investment of INR 20.01 Cr in battery startup Gegadyne Energy Labs, increasing stake to 24.32% (fully diluted). Gegadyne became associate company.
V-Guard incorporated V-Guard Consumer Products Limited (VCPL) as a wholly owned subsidiary for consumer products business.

IFB Industries invested up to INR 97 Cr in equity of IFB Refrigeration Limited (IRL) acquiring ~41.40% stake. IRL operates refrigerator manufacturing facility at Ranjangaon Pune. Commercial production commenced May 2023.

IFB's wholly-owned subsidiary GAAL (Global Automotive & Appliances Limited Singapore) established Schmid Automotive & Appliances GmbH in Switzerland for European design and tooling facility enhancing engineering capabilities.
Bulk deal on BSE involving 3,11,790 shares of Havells India traded at INR 1,305.60/share.

Havells cable manufacturing capacity expansion at Alwar Rajasthan. Initial INR 375 Cr (Jul 2024) + additional INR 340 Cr (May 2025). Cable production capacity from 32.90 lakh km to 41.45 lakh km. Funded from internal accruals.

Havells greenfield cable manufacturing plant at Tumakuru Karnataka commissioned Sep 2024. Additional INR 450 Cr committed for expansion of higher-sized cable capacity from 3.48 lakh km to 4.62 lakh km.

Havells received LOI for 50-acre land from YEIDA as anchor investor in 200-acre Electronics Manufacturing Cluster (EMC). JV with 5 other companies. Phase-1 investment ~INR 800 Cr. Production start by 2026. MeitY approved EMC Apr 25 2025.
Havells approved setting up new refrigerator manufacturing plant at Ghiloth Rajasthan with 14 lakh unit production capacity. Expected operational by Q2 FY27. Funded from internal accruals.
Havells co-led USD 4M (~INR 36.6 Cr) funding round in wellness startup Dhun Wellness (founded by Mira Kapoor) alongside SRF Ltd. Proceeds for expansion to Pune Hyderabad Bengaluru Ahmedabad.
Havells entered race to acquire 31% controlling stake in Whirlpool India but later stepped back due to valuation concerns and strategic focus on existing business.
Havells signed binding term sheet to invest INR 600 Cr in solar module manufacturer Goldi Solar for 8.9%-9.24% equity stake as part of Goldi's INR 1,300 Cr fundraise.
Havells acquired 26% stake in Kundan Solar (Pali) Pvt Ltd SPV for development of 15 MW captive solar power plant in Rajasthan. All-cash deal executed in phases tied to project milestones.
Havells settled trademark dispute with HPL Group, paying INR 129.60 Cr. HPL Group acknowledged Havells' absolute rights to the 'HAVELLS' trademark since 1971.
Havells among approved beneficiaries of PLI White Goods scheme for AC and LED manufacturing.

Symphony Board approved buyback of 10,00,000 equity shares at INR 2,000/share via tender offer aggregating up to INR 200 Cr. Record date: Mar 29, 2023. Tender period: May 3-17, 2023. Acceptance ratio ~9% for retail. Promoters participated.
Symphony Limited announced INR 71.40 Cr buyback covering 0.41% equity shares via tender offer. Open date: Aug 27, 2024. Close date: Sep 2, 2024.

Symphony's Chinese subsidiary GSK incorporated Dongguan GSK Appliances as new WOS in China. Authorized capital USD 70,100. Will engage in import/export and sales of consumer durables (air coolers, water heaters, tower fans, washing machines).

Board approved exploring divestment of stakes in Climate Technologies Australia (revenue INR 185 Cr FY24 negative EBITDA INR 23 Cr) and IMPCO Mexico (revenue INR 178 Cr FY24 EBITDA INR 27 Cr). Rationale: high capital intensity diluting ROCE. Attracted interest but no buyer met valuation expectations. Plans shelved.

Symphony's Chinese subsidiary GSK sold technology know-how and 9 IPRs to IMPCO Mexico subsidiary for USD 5.1M. GSK to deploy proceeds to repay loan to Symphony India potentially becoming debt-free. GSK retains substantial IPR portfolio for core markets.
Counterparty: IMPCO S de R.I. de C.V. (Intra-group)

Deal Description: Board expanded April 2025 divestment plan to include Symphony AU Pty Ltd (SAPL) the Australian SPV holding 100% of Climate Technologies. Broadened divestiture scope to full Australian operations. Later shelved after offers fell short of valuation expectations.

CK Birla Group (Orient Electric's parent group) sold 46.8% stake in Orient Cement to Ambuja Cements (Adani Group) for INR 8,100 Cr. Capital being reallocated to consumer-centric businesses including Orient Electric.

Dixon acquired 50.1% stake in Ismartu India (manufacturer for Transsion brands: Itel, Infinix, Tecno). CCI approved Jul 18, 2024. Deal in two tranches - Tranche 2 (1.7%-5.9%) to be acquired in 2026-27 based on FY26 PAT.
Counterparty: Ismartu India / Ismartu In Pte / Transsion Technology

Deal Description: Dixon and Vivo India signed binding term sheet for proposed JV for OEM manufacturing of electronic devices including smartphones. Dixon holds 51% stake.
Dixon and Signify Innovations signed binding term sheet for proposed JV focused on OEM business of lighting products and accessories in India.
Dixon signed binding term sheet to acquire 51% stake in Q Tech India for manufacturing camera modules and fingerprint modules for mobile, IoT, and automotive applications.
Dixon is a major beneficiary of PLI scheme for mobile phones and IT hardware. PLI allocation reduced to INR 1,527 Cr from INR 9,000 Cr. Uncertainty about mobile PLI extension post FY26.
Dixon planning $2.7-3 billion display fabrication facility (8.6G) in Noida in collaboration with China's HKC. Monthly capacity: 60,000 substrates. Fuelled by India Semiconductor Mission incentives.
Dixon Technologies issued $50 million corporate guarantee to wholly-owned subsidiary Padget Electronics for smartphone manufacturing operations.
Amber Enterprises raised ~INR 1,000 Cr via Qualified Institutional Placement. Allocated 12,57,861 equity shares at INR 7,950/share to qualified institutional buyers.
Board committee approved launch of second QIP of equity shares to raise up to INR 2,500 Cr with floor price of INR 7,790.88/share.

Amber raised INR 1,200 Cr from PE investors for subsidiary ILJIN Electronics via equity shares and CCPS. Investors include ChrysCapital Fund, Two Infinity Partners, Raptor Investments, InCred Growth Partners.
Counterparty: ChrysCapital / Two Infinity Partners / Raptor Investments / InCred Growth Partners

Deal Description: ILJIN Electronics acquired 60% stake in Power-One Micro Systems (BESS, solar inverters, EV chargers, UPS). Transaction concluded Aug 5, 2025.

ILJIN Electronics acquired ~40.24% controlling stake in Israel-based Unitronics (1989) Ltd. Purchased 56.24 lakh shares at NIS 27.75/share. Together with Unitronics Joint Chairman Haim Shani, ILJIN holds ~45.13%.
ILJIN Electronics entered definitive agreements to acquire majority stake in Shogini Technoarts, one of India's top 5 PCB manufacturers (Pune-based, est. 1982). Revenue: INR 390.74 Cr in FY25.
ILJIN gained control of Stelltek; the joint venture became a subsidiary with Stelltek becoming an ILJIN/Amber step-down subsidiary.

TTK Prestige board approved share buyback of 16,66,666 equity shares (1.2% equity) at INR 1,200/share via tender offer. 25% premium over market price. Acceptance ratio ~11% for retail investors. Record date: Aug 14, 2024. Tender period: Aug 21-27, 2024.

TTK Prestige invested in GramyaHaat Rural Tech Pvt Ltd (rural distribution startup) via Compulsorily Convertible Debentures (CCDs). Initial tranche INR 5 Cr with total commitment up to INR 15 Cr. Will result in >5% equity stake on conversion. No controlling stake.

Board approved INR 500 Cr capital allocation over 3 FYs starting Q4 FY25. INR 300 Cr for capex (stainless steel tri-ply capacities, appliances, plant modernization/automation) and INR 200 Cr for operational investments (innovation, design, manufacturing, go-to-market, logistics, service). Funded from internal accruals.

Following death of Chairman Emeritus T T Jagannathan (Oct 9, 2025), shares transmitted to legal heirs. Mukund T T acquired 20.8L shares (1.52%), Tiruvallur T Lakshman acquired 10.8L shares (0.79%). Aggregate promoter holding unchanged at ~70.52%.
TTK Prestige completed acquisition of 49% stake in modular kitchen maker Ultrafresh.

Crompton fully repaid final tranche of NCDs (INR 300 Cr principal, INR 323 Cr incl. interest) originally issued to fund 2022 Butterfly acquisition. Total NCD debt of INR 2,125 Cr across 5 tranches fully retired. Crompton becomes zero-debt and net cash positive.

Butterfly shareholders voted 72.61% against proposed merger with Crompton Greaves (swap ratio: 22 Crompton shares for 5 Butterfly shares). Non-institutional investors 97% against. Companies continue operating independently.
Johnson Controls announced sale of residential & light commercial HVAC business (incl. 60% JV with Hitachi) to Bosch for $8.1B total ($6.7B JC's portion). Includes 100% of JCHAC JV.
Bosch completed acquisition of JCHAC. Bosch now holds 74.25% controlling stake in the Indian entity. Open offer planned for remaining 25.75% minority shares.

Bosch made SEBI mandatory open offer for 25.75% minority stake (70,00,355 shares) at INR 1,762.54/share. Tendering period: Nov 13-26, 2025. 21,66,628 shares tendered (~31% acceptance). Consideration paid Dec 9, 2025. Bosch post-offer holding: ~82.22%.
Deal Value: INR ~382 Cr (actual paid) / INR ~1,234 Cr (max offer)
Counterparty: Robert Bosch GmbH / Bosch Global Software Technologies / Minority Shareholders

Deal Description: JCHAC was one of 42 applicants provisionally selected as beneficiary under PLI Scheme for White Goods (AC category) in Round 1. Incentives of 4-6% on incremental sales from domestic manufacturing over 5 years.
Company renamed from Johnson Controls-Hitachi Air Conditioning India Ltd to Bosch Home Comfort India Ltd (BOSCH-HCIL). Stock symbol changed from JCHAC to BOSCH-HCIL.

PLI scheme for white goods (ACs & LED lights) with INR 6,238 Cr outlay. 83 approved applicants by Oct 2025 with total investments of INR 10,400 Cr. Key tracked companies: Voltas, Havells, Dixon, Amber, Blue Star among applicants/beneficiaries. 4th round launched Sep 2025 attracted 13 new applications with INR 1,914 Cr committed investment.
Counterparty: Govt of India / DPIIT / Multiple Companies
